fields_of_interest: Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Trans-European Networks, Digital economy and society, Transport
eu_initiatives:
We inform and advise policy makers on appropriate policy frameworks to stimulate market introduction and remove potential deployment barriers for Intelligent Transport Systems and Services. 
  
We connect industry and policy stakeholders through the organisation of thematic events and workshops
organisation_name: European Road Transport Telematics Implementation Coordination Organisation-Intelligent Transport Systems & Services Europe (ERTICO-ITS Europe)
section: IV - Think tanks, research and academic institutions
membership:
-TISA (Traveller Information Services Association) 
-FIA (Fédération International de l'Automobile) 
-MaaS Alliance (Mobility as a Service)
relevant_communication:
ERTICO is involved in several EC projects. we have selected here some of them: 
ITS OBSERVATORY is EC PROJECT GA 653828. The three objectives of the ITS Observatory project are: 
-To bridge knowledge fragmentation by creating a common easily accessible EU-wide DB for ITS, research, pilots and deployment projects 
-Support ITS deployment by creating an intelligent software platform, which compares the results of research, pilots and deployment projects  
-Create a user-friendly decision-making tool to support fact-based policy making 
MOBINET : GA318485.MOBiNET will develop, deploy and operate the technical and organisational foundations of an open, multi-vendor 
platform for Europe-wide mobility services. 
AEOLIX is a EC project 690797 AEOLIXl develop a digital ecosystem to enable various actors at different levels and  of different sizes, with different systems and platforms or even without own in-house systems, to better manage, (re-) plan and/or synchronise freight and logistics operations across Europe. The AEOLIX digital ecosystem will improve data end-to-end visibility across the supply chain, enabling more sustainable and efficient transport of goods across Europe.  
NOVELOG: GA 636626 Urban areas represent the greatest challenges for freight transport and service trips, both in terms of goods distribution and 
service allocation performance, and environmental impacts (air emission, traffic congestion, road safety, accidents and 
noise).
